channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Inducing Systematicity in Transformers by Attending to Structurally Quantized Embeddings
item.description: Transformers generalize to novel compositions of structures and entities after being trained on a complex dataset, but easily overfit on datasets of insufficient complexity.

item.title: Reconstructing facade details using MLS point clouds and Bag-of-Words approach
item.description: We propose a new approach for the reconstruction of 3D fa\c{c}ade details.

item.title: InternLM-Math: Open Math Large Language Models Toward Verifiable Reasoning
item.description: We further explore how to use LEAN to solve math problems and study its performance under the setting of multi-task learning which shows the possibility of using LEAN as a unified platform for solving and proving in math.

item.title: Finding hardness reductions automatically using SAT solvers
item.description: In this article, we show that the completion problem, i. e. the decision problem whether a partial structure can be completed to a full structure, is NP-complete for many combinatorial structures.

item.title: Rethinking Node-wise Propagation for Large-scale Graph Learning
item.description: However, (i) Most scalable GNNs tend to treat all nodes in graphs with the same propagation rules, neglecting their topological uniqueness; (ii) Existing node-wise propagation optimization strategies are insufficient on web-scale graphs with intricate topology, where a full portrayal of nodes' local properties is required.

item.title: Classifying point clouds at the facade-level using geometric features and deep learning networks
item.description: 3D building models with facade details are playing an important role in many applications now.

item.title: Deceptive Path Planning via Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Deceptive path planning (DPP) is the problem of designing a path that hides its true goal from an outside observer.

item.title: ExaRanker-Open: Synthetic Explanation for IR using Open-Source LLMs
item.description: ExaRanker recently introduced an approach to training information retrieval (IR) models, incorporating natural language explanations as additional labels.

item.title: Retrieve, Merge, Predict: Augmenting Tables with Data Lakes
item.description: We present an in-depth analysis of data discovery in data lakes, focusing on table augmentation for given machine learning tasks.

item.title: Language Model Sentence Completion with a Parser-Driven Rhetorical Control Method
item.description: Controlled text generation (CTG) seeks to guide large language model (LLM) output to produce text that conforms to desired criteria.

item.title: Particle Denoising Diffusion Sampler
item.description: Denoising diffusion models have become ubiquitous for generative modeling.

item.title: The boundary of neural network trainability is fractal
item.description: Some fractals -- for instance those associated with the Mandelbrot and quadratic Julia sets -- are computed by iterating a function, and identifying the boundary between hyperparameters for which the resulting series diverges or remains bounded.

item.title: Understanding the Weakness of Large Language Model Agents within a Complex Android Environment
item.description: These challenges motivate AndroidArena, an environment and benchmark designed to evaluate LLM agents on a modern operating system.

item.title: Optimal estimation of Gaussian (poly)trees
item.description: We develop optimal algorithms for learning undirected Gaussian trees and directed Gaussian polytrees from data.

item.title: Model Editing with Canonical Examples
item.description: The Backpack defines a large bank of sense vectors--a decomposition of the different uses of each word--which are weighted and summed to form the output logits of the model.

item.title: Video Annotator: A framework for efficiently building video classifiers using vision-language models and active learning
item.description: High-quality and consistent annotations are fundamental to the successful development of robust machine learning models.

item.title: Where is the Truth? The Risk of Getting Confounded in a Continual World
item.description: A dataset is confounded if it is most easily solved via a spurious correlation which fails to generalize to new data.

item.title: Transferring facade labels between point clouds with semantic octrees while considering change detection
item.description: Point clouds and high-resolution 3D data have become increasingly important in various fields, including surveying, construction, and virtual reality.

item.title: Safe Guaranteed Exploration for Non-linear Systems
item.description: Based on this framework we propose an efficient algorithm, SageMPC, SAfe Guaranteed Exploration using Model Predictive Control.

item.title: ImplicitDeepfake: Plausible Face-Swapping through Implicit Deepfake Generation using NeRF and Gaussian Splatting
item.description: NeRFs encode the object's shape and color in neural network weights using a handful of images with known camera positions to generate novel views.

item.title: Learning Contrastive Feature Representations for Facial Action Unit Detection
item.description: To address the challenge posed by noisy AU labels, we augment the supervised signal through the introduction of a self-supervised signal.

item.title: Neural SPH: Improved Neural Modeling of Lagrangian Fluid Dynamics
item.description: Smoothed particle hydrodynamics (SPH) is omnipresent in modern engineering and scientific disciplines.

item.title: On the Efficacy of Eviction Policy for Key-Value Constrained Generative Language Model Inference
item.description: Despite the recent success associated with Large Language Models~(LLMs), they are notably cost-prohibitive to deploy in resource-constrained environments due to their excessive memory and computational demands.

item.title: Multimodal Interpretable Data-Driven Models for Early Prediction of Antimicrobial Multidrug Resistance Using Multivariate Time-Series
item.description: Electronic health records (EHR) is an inherently multimodal register of the patient's health status characterized by static data and multivariate time series (MTS).

item.title: Generative Adversarial Bayesian Optimization for Surrogate Objectives
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose generative adversarial Bayesian optimization (GABO) using adaptive source critic regularization, a task-agnostic framework for Bayesian optimization that employs a Lipschitz-bounded source critic model to constrain the optimization trajectory to regions where the surrogate function is reliable.

item.title: Evaluating Membership Inference Attacks and Defenses in Federated Learning
item.description: Firstly, combining model information from multiple communication rounds (Multi-temporal) enhances the overall effectiveness of MIAs compared to utilizing model information from a single epoch.

item.title: CoSearchAgent: A Lightweight Collaborative Search Agent with Large Language Models
item.description: Hence, to better support the research in collaborative search, in this demo, we propose CoSearchAgent, a lightweight collaborative search agent powered by LLMs.

item.title: Metamodeling and Control of Medical Digital Twins
item.description: Medical digital twins, computational models that integrate a wide range of health-related data about a person and can be dynamically updated, are a key technology that can help guide medical decisions.

item.title: PromptCrypt: Prompt Encryption for Secure Communication with Large Language Models
item.description: While these models offer substantial benefits in terms of accessibility and functionality, they also introduce significant privacy concerns: the transmission and storage of user data in cloud infrastructures pose substantial risks of data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information; even if the transmission and storage of data is encrypted, the LLM service provider itself still knows the real contents of the data, preventing individuals or entities from confidently using such LLM services.

item.title: Checking the Sufficiently Scattered Condition using a Global Non-Convex Optimization Software
item.description: However, this condition is NP-hard to check in general.

item.title: SPHINX-X: Scaling Data and Parameters for a Family of Multi-modal Large Language Models
item.description: We propose SPHINX-X, an extensive Multimodality Large Language Model (MLLM) series developed upon SPHINX.

item.title: Everybody Prune Now: Structured Pruning of LLMs with only Forward Passes
item.description: Given the generational gap in available hardware between lay practitioners and the most endowed institutions, LLMs are becoming increasingly inaccessible as they grow in size.

item.title: An Ordinal Regression Framework for a Deep Learning Based Severity Assessment for Chest Radiographs
item.description: This study investigates the application of ordinal regression methods for categorizing disease severity in chest radiographs.

item.title: Improving Token-Based World Models with Parallel Observation Prediction
item.description: We incorporate POP in a novel TBWM agent named REM (Retentive Environment Model), showcasing a 15. 4x faster imagination compared to prior TBWMs.

item.title: SoftEDA: Rethinking Rule-Based Data Augmentation with Soft Labels
item.description: Rule-based text data augmentation is widely used for NLP tasks due to its simplicity.

item.title: MIGC: Multi-Instance Generation Controller for Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: Lastly, we aggregate all the shaded instances to provide the necessary information for accurately generating multiple instances in stable diffusion (SD).

item.title: Quantum neural network with ensemble learning to mitigate barren plateaus and cost function concentration
item.description: The rapid development of quantum computers promises transformative impacts across diverse fields of science and technology.

item.title: Risk-Sensitive Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning in Network Aggregative Markov Games
item.description: Under a set of assumptions, we prove the convergence of the algorithm to a subjective notion of Markov perfect Nash equilibrium in NAMGs.

item.title: Optimizing for ROC Curves on Class-Imbalanced Data by Training over a Family of Loss Functions
item.description: Although binary classification is a well-studied problem in computer vision, training reliable classifiers under severe class imbalance remains a challenging problem.

item.title: PLAPT: Protein-Ligand Binding Affinity Prediction Using Pretrained Transformers
item.description: Understanding protein-ligand binding affinity is crucial for drug discovery, enabling the identification of promising drug candidates efficiently.

item.title: Anfinsen Goes Neural: a Graphical Model for Conditional Antibody Design
item.description: Antibody design plays a pivotal role in advancing therapeutics.

item.title: Spiking Neural Network Enhanced Hand Gesture Recognition Using Low-Cost Single-photon Avalanche Diode Array
item.description: We present a compact spiking convolutional neural network (SCNN) and spiking multilayer perceptron (SMLP) to recognize ten different gestures in dark and bright light environments, using a $9. 6 single-photon avalanche diode (SPAD) array.

item.title: Multi-Timescale Ensemble Q-learning for Markov Decision Process Policy Optimization
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) is a classical tool to solve network control or policy optimization problems in unknown environments.

item.title: Rapid Optimization for Jailbreaking LLMs via Subconscious Exploitation and Echopraxia
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have become prevalent across diverse sectors, transforming human life with their extraordinary reasoning and comprehension abilities.

item.title: Accurate LoRA-Finetuning Quantization of LLMs via Information Retention
item.description: This paper proposes a novel IR-QLoRA for pushing quantized LLMs with LoRA to be highly accurate through information retention.

item.title: Function Aligned Regression: A Method Explicitly Learns Functional Derivatives from Data
item.description: Regression is a fundamental task in machine learning that has garnered extensive attention over the past decades.

item.title: Examining Gender and Racial Bias in Large Vision-Language Models Using a Novel Dataset of Parallel Images
item.description: Following on recent advances in large language models (LLMs) and subsequent chat models, a new wave of large vision-language models (LVLMs) has emerged.

item.title: Noise Contrastive Alignment of Language Models with Explicit Rewards
item.description: Existing alignment methods, such as Direct Preference Optimization (DPO), are mainly tailored for pairwise preference data where rewards are implicitly defined rather than explicitly given.

item.title: Sandwiched Compression: Repurposing Standard Codecs with Neural Network Wrappers
item.description: Through a variety of examples, we apply the sandwich architecture to sources with different numbers of channels, higher resolution, higher dynamic range, and perceptual distortion measures.

item.title: You Only Need One Color Space: An Efficient Network for Low-light Image Enhancement
item.description: Further, we design a novel Color and Intensity Decoupling Network (CIDNet) with two branches dedicated to processing the decoupled image brightness and color in the HVI space.
